Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on Facebook posts from unofficial pages rather than verified information from MTN Nigeria.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that MTN is giving out 122GB of mobile data to subscribers based on the Facebook posts, without verifying the authenticity of the posts or the information.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that MTN Nigeria has denied running any such promotion or giveaway, as confirmed by their spokesperson.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that these Facebook pages are scams designed to collect personal information from unsuspecting users.
Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the offer of 122GB of mobile data, as it is not supported by official sources and is likely a false claim made by unauthorized Facebook pages.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in the provided claim.
Falters at times: The claim may falter at times by not considering the possibility of fraudulent activity and relying solely on the information from unofficial Facebook pages.
